title: Is MECHA Skin series for gigantic monsters?
body: as the title suggests, Is the MECHA for champs like Sion, Malph which are gigantic monster guys?

replies.body:
Here's how it works.

Battlecast=Beast.
Mecha=Semi-humanoid.
Project=Human.
Program=Semi-humanoid, good guys.

Am I missing one?

> [{quoted}](name=PhoenixOfHeaven,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=9vj772of,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-07-31T17:29:15.258+0000)
>
> Here's how it works.
> 
> Program=Semi-humanoid, good guys.
> 



How is {{champion:127}} one of the "good guys"?

...I actually don't get how I missed that. Welp....I guess Program just means it tries to make them look like good guys. Lighter colors, for a start. I love Liss, playstyle and lore wise, so the forgot she was a villain bothers me.

Honestly they don't appear that "good".

Just because Program Lissandra uses white colors doesn't mean she is any less villainous.

Personally I believe that the program line consist of a bunch of robots who "protect" humanity,but who do it through opression,kinda like the robots from I robot.

Personally I used to think the program skin line were anthropomorphic representations of digital program across the web (like in settings where the story takes place in cyberspace). 

Then Program Camille showed up and it was revealed they were another group of robots. 

_sigh_.

Nah of course, evil robots could still be in lighter colors, Chrome being a popular one. But their faces in general seem nicer, compared to Mecha, where a lot of em look like they wanna destroy something.

I was thinking of mentioning I,Robot, but I thought it would seem out of place! Yeah, Not the 'good' robots the 'better' robots.
Beasts... I don't see Xerath or Viktor as beasts...
Xerath isn't a member of the Battlecast skinline. Only the same name, believe it or not. And Viktor is just the leader, he's there not to fit the skin line, but for lore reasons.

What world are you living in? Xerath is indeed part of the skinline.

He's even on the Battlecast skin site http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/skin-release/battlecast-skins

To be fair,Viktor isn't called Battlecast viktor,he is called Creator viktor.
He is the creator of the battlecast champs,but he isn't one himself.

And Xerath can be excuse by the fact that he was the first bc skin and was done before they had a solid direction for the series.
Well he's still part of the theme in a way, just like Xerath, so they aren't beasts.

heres how i see it
battlecast=bruisers
Mecha=monsters
project=assassins/adc
program=mages

Not really.
Malphite is a giant monster guy, but Sion and Aatrox  are smaller. Bigger than a normal human, but not that big compared to champs like Galio, Cho'gath and Anivia. I have no idea how big Kha'zix is.
So no, the Mecha skins are not only for the giant monsters.

Sion is human...

At least he was...

He is doing his best okay ?

It most likely depends on how well the concept works for the champion.

If they have a cool idea for a mechaskin for a human,then they might make one for said human.
If they don't have one they won't make one.

If you want to put them in a category ;)
The term is 'Colosi' :P If it ends in -us then you add an I. Octopi, Cacti.
